needs.title: Small Tarpaulins
needs.description: Small tarps to cover exposed areas and protect belongings from rain while roof repairs proceed.

neededBy.reason: Must be in place to protect the home from rain before other phases begin.

needs.title: Heavy Duty Tarpaulins
needs.description: Heavy-duty tarpaulins to span the open roof bays and keep the family dry until rebuild crews mobilize.

neededBy.reason: Must be in place to provide durable weather protection before roof rebuild.

needs.title: Rope & Bungee Securing Kits
needs.description: Tie-down kits to tension tarps across broken rafters without ripping the remaining structure.

neededBy.reason: Required on 1 Nov to lash tarps securely and prevent uplift during night squalls.

needs.title: Large Garbage Bags
needs.description: Rolls of large garbage bags for temporary leak protection, debris control, and waste segregation.

neededBy.reason: Needed to line bedding and capture soaked insulation while tarps go up.

needs.title: Kerosene
needs.description: Kerosene for lighting lamps and cooking while power remains offline.

neededBy.reason: Essential for household lighting and cooking during power outage.

needs.title: Portable Generator
needs.description: 5 kW portable generator to power pumps, refrigeration, and comms gear while grid power is offline.

neededBy.reason: Farm metabolism depends on backup power on 1 Nov to stop feed spoilage.

needs.title: Heavy-Duty Extension Cables
needs.description: Outdoor-rated extension cords to tie the generator into the farmhouse safely.

neededBy.reason: Power continuity setup must be ready by 1 Nov before refrigeration restart.

needs.title: Generator Fuel Reserve
needs.description: Stabilized gasoline/diesel drums that keep the generator running for several nights.

neededBy.reason: Fuel needs to be staged on 1 Nov to avoid downtime before grid repairs.

needs.title: Water Storage Drums
needs.description: Food-grade drums that hold potable water when the pump or public supply is offline.

neededBy.reason: Must be ready 1 Nov so the household can store clean water for livestock and family.

needs.title: Mosquito Coils & Repellent
needs.description: Coils and repellents that keep biting insects away while windows remain open.

neededBy.reason: Vector control is needed by 1 Nov to protect the family and livestock after flooding.

needs.title: House Roof – 26-Gauge Zinc Sheets
needs.description: 10–30 sheets of 26-gauge galvanized zinc to fully re-cover the farmer's home roof spans.

neededBy.reason: Roof decking is exposed; zinc needs to be installed before the next rain band.

needs.title: House Roof Structural Lumber
needs.description: Bundles of 2x4 rafters, 1x3 battens, and 4x4 posts to replace damaged members and reinforce load paths.

neededBy.reason: Rafters and battens must be replaced before zinc sheets can be tied down.

needs.title: Roof Nails & Fasteners
needs.description: Roofing nails with rubber washers plus 3" and 4" construction nails for framing tie-in.

neededBy.reason: Fasteners are required for reinstalling the structural frame and zinc sheets.

needs.title: House Hurricane Straps
needs.description: Metal straps to connect rafters to wall beams for wind-resistant reconstruction.

neededBy.reason: Tie-downs must be in place before final inspection to prevent future uplift.

needs.title: House Roof Ridge Cap
needs.description: Galvanized ridge capping to seal the roof peak against rain intrusion.

neededBy.reason: Ridge caps finish the roof assembly and prevent water penetration at the crown.

needs.title: Tar Paper / Underlayment
needs.description: Waterproof membrane layer to protect the timber deck before zinc installation.

neededBy.reason: Underlayment is needed immediately after structural repairs to keep the interior dry.

needs.title: Sealant & Flashing Tape
needs.description: Sealant tubes and flashing tape for leak prevention around joints and penetrations.

neededBy.reason: Sealing joints prevents vector ingress once zinc is installed.

needs.title: Roof Work Safety PPE
needs.description: Helmets, gloves, harnesses, and boots to keep roof crews safe during demolition and installation.

neededBy.reason: Working at height requires PPE before crews can start stripping the roof.

needs.title: Structural Carpenter
needs.description: 1–2 carpenters skilled in rafter replacement and frame alignment for the farmer's house roof.

neededBy.reason: Experienced carpenters are required to rebuild the timber frame before zinc install.

needs.title: Roofing Installers
needs.description: Crew experienced with zinc installation, fastening patterns, and overlap geometry for the home roof.

neededBy.reason: Dedicated installers keep the roof schedule tight once materials arrive.

needs.title: General Labor – Housing Roof
needs.description: 1–2 laborers for debris removal, staging materials, and assisting carpenters on the roof.

neededBy.reason: Support labor keeps the roof crew productive and site safe.

needs.title: Power Saw
needs.description: Medium-size power saw for cutting tree branches and limbs blocking the pasture and fence line.

neededBy.reason: Trees have fallen down in pasture blocking grass growth. Cows cannot get to the grass.

needs.title: Chainsaw Fuel
needs.description: Fuel mix required for operating chainsaws during tree clearing.

neededBy.reason: Required for chainsaw operation during tree clearing.

needs.title: Chainsaw Bar Oil
needs.description: Bar oil to keep saws lubricated during continuous biomass removal.

neededBy.reason: Continuous cutting requires bar oil to avoid downtime from seized bars.

needs.title: Spare Chainsaw Chains
needs.description: Replacement chains so operators can keep working while sharpening dull chains.

neededBy.reason: Cutting hardwood posts quickly dulls chains; spares keep production up.

needs.title: Machetes
needs.description: Carbon steel machetes for stripping vines, brush, and young saplings.

neededBy.reason: Brush clearing crews need sharp machetes to keep pace with chainsaw work.

needs.title: Rakes & Forks
needs.description: Heavy-duty rakes and pitchforks for pulling biomass into piles and reopening pathways.

neededBy.reason: Manual crews need hand tools to move vines and leaves after felling.

needs.title: Wheelbarrows
needs.description: Heavy-duty wheelbarrows for transporting debris, cut posts, and manure buildup off pathways.

neededBy.reason: Without wheelbarrows the manual crews cannot keep up with biomass removal.

needs.title: Cutlass Sharpening File
needs.description: Metal files to keep cutlasses and machetes sharp throughout the clearing operation.

neededBy.reason: Sharp tools reduce fatigue for machete crews clearing vines.

needs.title: Chainsaw Labor
needs.description: 1–2 certified chainsaw operators for felling, limbing, and bucking storm-fallen trees.

neededBy.reason: Trees need to be cut to clear pasture and allow grass to grow.

needs.title: Power Saw Work
needs.description: Operators to cut suitable trees into fence posts and clear thicker limbs.

neededBy.reason: Posts need to be cut from trees for fence construction.

needs.title: Manual Labor - Clearing
needs.description: Manual labor to move branches, stack biomass, and reopen fence lines after chainsaw cuts.

neededBy.reason: Move branches and debris after chainsaw cuts to clear fence line.

needs.title: Machete Work Labor
needs.description: Crew members focused on stripping vines, brush, and young saplings.

neededBy.reason: Additional clearing work needed after chainsaw operation.

needs.title: Manual Labor - Move Posts
needs.description: Manual labor to move posts (lift 20-30lbs) for fence construction and debris staging.

neededBy.reason: Posts need to be moved and positioned for fence installation.

needs.notes: Workers need to be able to lift 20-30lbs repeatedly.

needs.title: Posts (Man Cut) - 500 posts
needs.description: 500 man-cut posts for fence construction and repair. Trees need to be cut with power saw to make posts.

neededBy.reason: Essential for fence repair. Posts need to be cut from trees using power saw.

needs.title: Barb Wire - 5 Rolls
needs.description: 5 rolls of 12½ gauge barb wire for fence repair and pasture restoration.

neededBy.reason: Needed for fence repair after hurricane damage.

needs.title: Staples for Fence Wire
needs.description: Galvanized U-nails for attaching barb wire to posts.

neededBy.reason: Required for securing barb wire to posts.

needs.title: Fence Tensioning Tools
needs.description: Come-along and wire stretcher set to achieve proper barb wire tension.

neededBy.reason: Tensioning tools are required to stretch barb wire over the 35-acre perimeter.

needs.title: Post Hole Tools
needs.description: Digging bar, post hole shovel, and manual auger for installing 500 posts.

neededBy.reason: Posts cannot be set without specialty digging tools.

needs.title: Fence Hammers & Sledge
needs.description: Hammers and a sledgehammer for driving staples and tamping soil around posts.

neededBy.reason: Install crews need dedicated hammers to secure staples and posts.

needs.title: Fence Crew PPE
needs.description: Gloves, boots, and safety glasses to protect workers handling barbed wire and posts.

neededBy.reason: Wire handling is hazardous without protective gear.

needs.title: Post Installation Labor
needs.description: Crew to dig holes, align posts, and secure them along the 35-acre boundary.

neededBy.reason: Posts must be installed to restore fence perimeter.

needs.title: Barb Wire Installers
needs.description: Crew skilled at running, tensioning, and stapling barb wire safely along long perimeters.

neededBy.reason: Dedicated installers keep the fence schedule on track once posts are set.

needs.title: Cow Shed Lumber
needs.description: Pressure-treated lumber for rafters, purlins, posts, and stall framing in the cow shed.

neededBy.reason: Structure cannot be rebuilt without new treated lumber.

needs.title: Cow Shed Concrete Mix
needs.description: 3–6 bags of concrete mix for post footings and slab patching inside the shed.

neededBy.reason: Footings must be stabilized before the shed frame is raised.

needs.title: Cow Shed Fasteners
needs.description: Roofing nails, lag bolts, and structural screws for the shed frame and roof.

neededBy.reason: Fasteners tie the shed frame together and secure zinc sheets.

needs.title: Cow Shed Hurricane Straps
needs.description: Tie-down straps to secure rafters and posts on the rebuilt cow shed.

neededBy.reason: Straps keep the agricultural structure anchored during future storms.

needs.title: Cow Shed Zinc Roofing
needs.description: 10–20 sheets of zinc roofing separate from the house roof to cover the cow shed.

neededBy.reason: Shelter is needed to reduce animal stress and restart milk production.

needs.title: Cow Shed Gutters & Downspouts
needs.description: Gutter lengths and downspouts to capture rainwater for cows and protect the slab.

neededBy.reason: Rainwater capture offsets hauling water during recovery.

needs.title: Cow Shed Stall Components
needs.description: Boards, support frames, and feeding trough replacements for dairy stalls.

neededBy.reason: Stalls must be restored before cows can reoccupy the shed.

needs.title: Cow Shed Carpenters
needs.description: 1–2 carpenters specialized in agricultural buildings to rebuild shed framing.

neededBy.reason: Framing professionals keep the shed rebuild on structural spec.

needs.title: Cow Shed Roof Installers
needs.description: Crew experienced with zinc roofing and gutter installation for the cow shed.

neededBy.reason: Roof installers complete the shed weatherproofing stage.

needs.title: General Farm Labor – Shed
needs.description: Two general laborers to carry lumber, hold panels, and clear the shed site.

neededBy.reason: Support labor keeps carpenters and roofers productive during the rebuild.
